attributes.comment:
As a prospective adoptive parent awaiting the referral of our first child from China,
the additional expenses proposed are upsetting and frustrating. Due to the longer
wait times in China we already are incurring additonal expenses to re-submit the
I600A application as our first I171H is due to expire in July. The increase is not a
minimal one but a huge leap. The expenses incurred just to get to submit an
application are hard enough but to increase the fees to this extent is just unfair.
There has to be a better way. For parents like myself re-submitting and paying the
same fees all over again for a duplication of work when a simple renewal form
would decrrease our overall I171H expenses just doesn't make sense. I'd rather
spend the proposed increase on the child I have waited my whole life for. I
sincerely hope that more of a discussion is held about this issue prior to its
approval.

Kimberly Gaudiosi

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kimberly A. Gaudiosi
